result.execSummary:
The defendant Krista M. Buckpitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs/surcharges.

Supervision fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:52 p.m. Defendant Krista M. Buckpitt in court in custody with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Plea agreement outlines provided by both parties.
In 15cf154 - State moves to dismiss but read in Counts 1, 3, 4 and 6 - Granted. In 15cf275 State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 2 - Granted. In 15cf127 State moves to dismiss but read-in Counts 1, 3 and 5 - Granted. In 14cf240 State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 2 - Granted. In 15cf240 - State moves to dismiss but read in Count Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to remaining counts.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Bennett/Court statement on sentencing. Bennett provides letter from treatment provider. 

Court Sentence
15cf154 - Count 2
WHS/POP - 3 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Conditional Jail - 104 days with Huber for all purposes
Community Service - 100 hours
AODA Assessment and follow-thru
No intoxicants, no taverns, no illegal drugs
Continue treatment at Koinonia
If successfully completes treatment at Koinonia - day for day credit will be given
Jail credit - 41 days (consolidated credit from all cases)
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Count 5
WHS/POP 3 years 
CC/Supervision Fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

15CF275
Jail - 30 days with Huber for all purposes
CC

15cf127 - 
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/Supervision Fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

14cf240
WHS/POP - 3 years
CC/Supervision Fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

15cf240
Jail - 30 days with Huber for all purposes
CC

In 14cf240 and 15cf154 - Special disposition under 973.015 if all fines/costs/surcharges is paid in full and successfully completes probation. 

Appeal rights given.
Adj. 4:24 p.m.

11:33 a.m. Defendant Krista M. Buckpitt in court, via video, with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Krista M. Buckpitt in custody.   Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf240, 15cf127, 15cf154, 15cf240 and 15cf275. In 15cf275, Bennett statement to confusion with jail and bringing defendant over for personal appearance -   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State files Information - Bennett motion to modify bond to permit defendant to attend Koinonia or other in-patient facility and day for day credit - Bednar statement to motion Court grants motion if unable to post cash bond but available AODA treatment - may leave jail for that purpose - if defendant leaves treatment and does not return to jail - would be considered escape by statute - Court also allows sentence credit for time spent in in-patient facility. Bennett in receipt of Information - waives further reading - enters not guilty pleas on all counts. Adj. 11:44 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

8:46 a.m. Defendant Krista M. Buckpitt in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf240, 15cf127, 14cf240 and 15cf154. In 15cf240   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
. Bednar statement to bond. Other cases not yet ready for global resolution.  Court sets $5000 sig bond in 15cf240. All cases scheduled for status/pre-trial conference on 12-01-15 at 03:00 p.m. Bail continued in other matters.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm. Adj. 8:49 a.m.

3:39 p.m. Defendant Krista M. Buckpitt in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf154, 15cf127, and 14cf240.  In 15cf154 -   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State will file Information. Bennett enters pleas of not guilty. Bail continued. Adj. 3:44 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

04:03 pm - Defendant Krista M. Buckpitt in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf240 (PTC) and 15cf127 (AIA).  In 14cf240 - an offer was accepted and rejected and defendant would like to engage in treatment.  In 15cf127 - Bennett just informed of this case.  Requests a preliminary hearing.  Prelim time limits waived.  Bail continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 11:15 am.

03:18 pm - Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court. Defendant does not appear.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bennett in reciept of offer - requests adjournment to finalize details and other issues.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

02:06 pm - Defendant Krista M. Buckpitt in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bennett states rec'd offer from Bednar - rejection counter offer provided to DA's office by defense.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
